etymology.description: Phono-semantic: 垚 (yáo, "tall (of earth)") as phonetic + 兀 (wù, "towering and bald") as semantic -> representing height and eminence. Ideogrammic: 垚 (yáo, "tall (of earth)") + 兀 (wù, "towering and bald") = symbolizing an elevated stature -> legendary ruler
etymology.interpretation: The character 堯(堯) (yáo) combines phonetic and semantic elements to convey the idea of being tall or eminent, fitting for a legendary ruler known for his height and stature in tradition.

examples.chinese: 堯是传说中的圣君(堯是傳說中的聖君)。
examples.pinyin: Yáo shì chuánshuō zhōng de shèng jūn.
examples.english: Yao is a legendary virtuous ruler.

examples.chinese: 古代文献赞誉堯(古代文獻讚譽堯)，称他治理有方(稱他治理有方)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénxiàn zànyù Yáo, chēng tā zhìlǐ yǒu fāng.
examples.english: Ancient texts praise Yao, saying he governed with wisdom.
